text.value: Hello, Noble Born. I am Shadout Mapes, the well-dipper, at your service.
There are 3 ways you can position the camera.
Move the camera in 2 directions to show me that you understand.
Now zoom back in.

padText.value: Now zoom back in by pressing [Camera_Tactical] again.

text.value: You can also press [Camera_Tactical] to enter tactical view directly.
Now you are going to learn how to select a unit, order it around and attack.
That's how you order units around, Noble Born. Remember it well, and let's move on to the next lesson.
Now, you need to learn to control the flow of time.
There are 2 ways to pause and unpause the game.
Try to pause the game.
Good. Now, unpause the game.
Good. Now, unpause the game.
There is one last thing you need to know before we go further.
There are a lot of information and tools in your interface. We'll get through every one of them over time. But you might want to explore them on your own.
You can always press [UseFloatingCursor] to summon a cursor on the screen, and move it on whatever you don't understand with [CameraZoom_Gamepad] to get an explanation.
There are 2 ways to change the speed of the game.
1. You can press [Time_Faster] to increase the speed and [Time_Slower] to decrease it.
Increase the speed of the game up to X2.
And now go back to the regular speed.
Today, we'll learn how to capture and defend [!Village]s. First, you will recruit an army.
Recruiting an army is done from the Military interface on the right side of the screen. Recruit one [!A_Trooper] and one [!A_Soldier].
Training soldiers takes time. There is nothing we can do but wait for them to be ready.
Well done, Noble Born. Your soldiers are ready for a little incursion outside of [Arrakeen].
Look at this weak [!Village]. Annexing it will provide great practice for you and your troops.
Select your 2 units and [MouseRight] right-click on the neutral [!Village] to attack.

padText.value: Select your 2 units and press [Game_RightClick] on the neutral [!Village] to attack.

text.value: Keep your units in the zone of occupation until the Annexation is over.
The Annexation has failed because you have not left any unit in the occupation circle. Try again.
You have lost all your units. We'll have to start again from the beggining.
Noble Born, congratulations. You have annexed your first [!Village].
Your new [!Village] will attract jealousy. Word gets out that [!Harkonnen-adjective] swines are already planning an attack. You need to prepare your defenses.
A [!Harkonnen-adjective] raid is on its way. Defend yourself.
Tomorrow, I will teach you how to harvest the precious [Spice].
You need an [Ornithopter] to explore the planet.
Building an [Ornithopter] takes some time. We have to be patient, and wait.
This is a [!Village]. They are the spine of your economy. We will focus on capture and exploitation of [!Village]s later. For now, let's get back to exploration.
This is a natural resource, that will provide bonuses to the region. You can select it to discover its effect.
The region is fully reconned! You know a lot more about your surroundings already.
You can press [Toggle_Zone_Info] on your keyboard to display additional information about the regions and [!Village]s of Arrakis.

padText.value: You can see many information on regions and [!Village]s of Arrakis when you are in the strategic map. Use this knowledge wisely.

text.value: Wait for your [Ornithopter] to explore the next region.
We're lucky! This is a Special Region! They are recognizable by their [SpecialRegion] icon. They provide powerful bonuses.
Tomorrow, you will learn how to recruit units, annex and defend [!Village]s.
[Spice] can only be harvested from a [SpiceArea] in a controlled region, like this one.
Constructing any [Building_Village] takes time, but we can wait.
A carryall carries your [A_Harvester] to and from the [SpiceArea].
Select the [A_Harvester] and [MouseLeft] click on the [AddCrew] button to add a [CrewPoint].
To add [CrewPoint]s, select the [A_Harvester], open the selected unit wheel by pressing [OpenSelectionWheel] and choose the [AddCrew] option.
Harvested [Spice] is either immediately sold for [Solari] or stockpiled to pay the [$my(contract)].
Harvested [Spice] is either immediately sold for [Solari] or stockpiled to pay the [$my(contract)].

To change how much spice you stockpile, you need to use the Spice Report. To get to the Spice Report, open the menu navigation wheel by pressing [OpenMainWheel], then choose the [SpiceReportWindow] option.
Here is the [SpiceReport]. You can see the price for selling [Spice]. The base price is the same for everyone in the universe, but the real price also changes with your reputation and other factors.
You are too greedy Noble Born, your [A_Harvester] has been eaten by Shai Hulud.
When destroyed, [A_Harvester]s are automatically rebuilt at the [Refinery] but it takes some time.
Your new [A_Harvester] is ready, deploy it when the [Sandworm] has left to resume the [Spice] harvesting.
Your [A_Harvester] is working in the desert, making a lot of noise. It will eventually attract a [Sandworm].
[A_Harvester]s return automatically to the [Refinery] when a [Sandworm] is near.
There are two ways to operate [A_Harvester]s: [!Greedy_Harvester] and [!Safe_Harvester].
In [!Greedy_Harvester], [A_Harvester]s remain on the field until the last seconds before the [Sandworm] surfaces.
They gather a lot of [Spice] that way, but incur high risk of losing [A_Harvester] and [CrewPoint]s.
In [!Safe_Harvester], [A_Harvester]s are recalled as soon as a worm is detected, ensuring a safe return.
Assigning an [Ornithopter] to [A_Harvester]s allows for the use of [!Safe_Harvester] and reduce the chance of losing [A_Harvester]s in [!Greedy_Harvester].
Select an [Ornithopter] and [MouseRight] right-click on a [A_Harvester] to assign it to worm spotting.

padText.value: Select an [Ornithopter] and press [Game_RightClick] on a [A_Harvester] to assign it to worm spotting.

text.value: To put your [A_Harvester] in a specific mode, you have to select it and [MouseLeft] click on the corresponding button.

padText.value: To put your [A_Harvester] in a specific mode, you have to select it. Then, press [Selection_SafeMode] to put it in [!Safe_Harvester] or [Selection_GreedMode] to put it in [!Greedy_Harvester].

text.value: In this tutorial, we will learn about [Solari] Upkeep and Neighboring Effects.
Launch an attack on the neutral [Village]!
Good, now annex the neutral [Village]!
[WindTrap]s turn [Wind] into [Water].
Build a [WindTrap] in your [Village] with the highest [Wind].
You can use the [Toggle_Zone_Info] key to display the [Wind].
The [Village] you built your [WindTrap] in doesn't have enough [Wind] to produce the required [Water].
Build your [WindTrap] in the other [Village] to maximize the production.
Congratulations!
Now we are gonna talk about [Water]!
Congratulations!
Now we are gonna talk about [Solari] Upkeep and Neighboring Effects!
The [PlascreteFactory] produces [Plascrete] allowing you to construct more [Building]s.
Build a [PlascreteFactory] .
Your [Plascrete] production is higher now, it will allow you to construct more [Building]s.
You can select a [Building] to look at its Upkeep.
Select your [PlascreteFactory].
[PlascreteFactory]s have one of the highest Upkeep, build them parsimoniously.
You can hover your [Solari] stock to see the detail of all your Upkeep.
Hover your [Solari] stock.
Now we are gonna learn ways to reduce your [Solari] Upkeep.
The [MaintenanceCenter] is a [Building] that reduces the Upkeep of the other [Building]s of [Village]s.
Select the [Village] in the middle Region and build the [MaintenanceCenter].
The Upkeep of your [Village]s are now lower.
Now we are gonna show you a more "radical" method to reduce your Upkeep.
Demolish [Building]s to have more than 40 [Solari] production.
Select a [Building] and [MouseLeft] click on [Demolish] to demolish it.
When you are running short of [Solari], look at your Upkeep and try to lower it with what you just learnt.
Let's start our first mock council.
This is the [LandsraadCouncil]. While the council is in progress, the game is paused.
In the middle of the screen are the three resolutions under examination during this council: [InfrastructureValidations], [VehicleRegulation], and [SurveillanceCommittee].
Each resolution can be of two scopes: it either affects everybody equally, like [SurveillanceCommittee], or it only targets one faction, like the other two.
All three resolutions are examinated at the same time. It means that you have to allocate your [CouncilVote]s intelligently.
Some prefer to put all their [CouncilVote]s on a single resolution, while others distribute them between the three for a more diffuse impact.
Now, let's vote. For each resolution, choose the outcome you prefer and increase the vote count, until you've used all your [CouncilVote]s.

padText.value: Now, let's vote. For each resolution, choose the outcome you prefer with [Menu_LeftClick] and increase the vote count with [CycleSelect_Increase], until you've used all your [CouncilVote]s.

text.value: If you keep increasing the vote count, it will use [Influence] instead, and the count will be blue. Click on the Confirm button whenever you are happy with your votes.

padText.value: If you keep increasing the vote count, it will use [Influence] instead, and the count will be blue. Go to the Confirm button and press [Menu_LeftClick] whenever you are happy with your votes.

text.value: Voting is over, sir! You can see how many votes each proposition has received. Hover on results to get the details of where the votes come from.

padText.value: Voting is over! You can see how many votes each proposition has received. Go over the results to get the details of where the votes come from.

text.value: Each resolution that was approved will apply its effects immediately, and until the next council in 20 days.
The council is now over. You can unpause and close the window.

padText.value: The council is now over. You can close the window with [Menu_Back] and unpause.

text.value: The third important political resource is [Standing]. It represents how much the whole Landsraad community appreciates you.
A [Standing_High] will give you many bonuses, while a [Standing_Low] will hurt your success in the politics.
[Standing] can raise slowly over time, mostly through alliances. But it can decrease abruptly if you betray an ally.
[Standing] can bring many advantages. And having a high [Standing] makes you eligible to [Charter]s.
Click on the [Landsraad] button, and let's go look at the [Charter]s.
Let's go look at the [Charter]s. To open the [Landsraad] outside of a council, open the menu navigation wheel by pressing [OpenMainWheel], then choose the [LandsraadWindow] option.
Set your cursor on a [Charter] to see both its effect and the prerequisites to become a candidate.
I'll give you enough [Standing] and make you eligible to [CouncilSpeaker], so we can proceed.
Now, you can be elected to the [CouncilSpeaker] [Charter], but the subject still needs to be on the council agenda if you want to have a chance to get elected.
For a [Charter] to appear on the ballot, it needs to have at least ::value(Landsraad_MinimumCharterInvestment):: [AgendaPriority] and to have the most [AgendaPriority].
Now that you have raised its [AgendaPriority] above ::value(Landsraad_MinimumCharterInvestment)::, [CouncilSpeaker] will be examined in the agenda of the next [LandsraadCouncil]
You were supposed to raise [CouncilSpeaker] priority, but if you think it's better this way, so be it.
It's now time for our second mock council.
Some resolution modifiers appear randomly, like [LandsraadFavorite], and some can be added by player factions.
It's time to vote again, exactly like in the previous council.
Unlike other resolutions, [Charter]s last until a new vote is called for the same [Charter].
We spotted a [CrashedShuttle] discovery, far away from your territory.
Send your [A_Trooper] back to your [!Village].
Near an ally [!Village] or your Main Base, units will regenerate [Supply].
Let's wait for your [A_Trooper] to be fully supplied.
We need more [Water] to reach the [CrashedShuttle].
The easiest way to produce [Water] is to build [DewCollector]s in [!Village]s.
Build a [DewCollector] in every of your three [!Village]s.
There are many other sources of [Water] but you will have to find them on your own.
The [CrashedShuttle] is still a bit too far away. We should also look at our [Water] consumption.
Remember: [DewCollector]s are producing and not consuming [Water]. You should not demolish them.
Demolish enough [!Building_Village]s to have 25 [Water].
Now you have enough [Water] to reach the [CrashedShuttle].
Complete the investigation of the [CrashedShuttle].
Good, now resolve the discovery.
The CHOAM calls for help. This is an opportunity to take control of [::territory::] without a drop of blood. We only need to outbuy the other Houses.
CHOAM instability is bad for the whole Imperium. We should remind everyone why [Corrino-longname] is at the helm.
This place is sacred for the Fremen. You might have good intentions, but others won't. Help us protect it, and we will part as friends.
You found our sacred sietch. Now what, offworlder? Some of us hope you might be better than the others. What do you have to say?
A snake has invited itself on Arrakis. The [::territory_owner::-adjective] supervisor of [::territory::] is a threat to both our plans and yours. We can help you remove him.
Now that we know of their secrets, the path forward is clear. Only start the assassination when you are ready. We cannot afford to waste time with failure.

My fremen contacts have told me that a [Sietch] in the region has special value to the local population. We should try to find out more about this [SietchAncient] before it falls into the wrong hands.
The story says an [SietchAncient] precious to the Fremen is located in this region. We must find it before a disloyal house gets hold of it.
I've heard the fremen are protecting an [SietchAncient] full of secrets and wonders in this region. If we are perceptive enough, we may find it soon enough.
I'm going to free this place from [::territory_owner::-adjective] influence. Their vigilance is down, they won't have time to react.
We got close without [::territory_owner::-shortname] noticing. If we're fast enough, we might avoid a bloodshed. A battle of speed and wit, in the heart of the desert.
[::territory_owner::] are too negligent. I'm going to take this place fast and clean.
[::territory_owner::] have not taken good care of this place. If we attack swiftly, they might not be able to react.
They've no idea we're here. I'm gonna break them like little twigs, before they even react.
These fools have slipped, leaving [::territory::] at my mercy. I'll strike with force, fast and bloody.
The [::territory_owner::-shortname] should have kept their eyes on [::territory::]. If we move fast, they will not be able to react.
The [::territory_owner::-shortname] are not good keeper of this land. They have not even noticed we're here. Let's strike them where it hurts.
We've planned this assault for months. They know we are coming. We have to win. For Atreides!
This battle is decisive. We will succeed.
The blood of [::territory_owner::-adjective] men will flow today. We take their [ConquestBase] and the land is ours.
We can expect heavy resistance, but we've come in force. It'll be a great battle where boys become men, and glory is gained by all!
We need to increase our ground footprint on Arrakis to be legitimate in our claim. The [::territory::] is currently unclaimed land. It is our best candidate for a relatively peaceful annexation.
The [::territory::] is unclaimed. If we grab the land before anyone else has the time to do it, it might form a good base for our economy on Arrakis.
We cannot rule without imposing our will on the population. With enough people under our thumb, we gain control of their dream and fear! You know how powerful that is!
The [::territory::] is a nice piece of land, but war is coming. Will it be spared under our protection?
The [::territory::] is a critical land for economical growth and local support. We need to secure it to ensure our future on Arrakis. I expect heavy resistance.
The [::territory::] is a strategic point for our plan on Arrakis. I'm surprised that it is still unclaimed. We should demonstrate our superiority here, once and for all.
The [::territory::] has been empty for so long. What a mistake! It's the key to domination on Arrakis! And it should be ours!
I don't like to bring our wars on these lands, but the [::territory::] is critical. We cannot let the other Houses get to it first.
The prestigious [::signature_region::] could be very useful to our development. Nobody has taken claim on it yet, but it won't be the case for very long.
We should take [::signature_region::] and hold onto it to demonstrate to all the supremacy of [Corrino].
[::signature_region::] is right here for the taking. Everyone knows it. It's going to be a race! Or maybe a brawl... Anyway, we should prevail.
[::signature_region::] is such a beautiful sight. But it'll be even better with our flag on it. Don't let the other Houses take it.
We've detected an imminent assault on your position. Hold them off until I arrive. We're going to get you through this, you hear me?
An assault on your position has been detected. I'm coming to you with a full legion of reinforcements. Today is not the day you die, soldier. It's the day you rise up and hold.
The enemy is nearly there. I'm coming to end their foolish incursion. Hold on until then.
They are coming for you. How dare they defy Father's authority? It cannot stand! Hold your position at all cost, soldier, we are coming.
The weaklings are trying to take our land from us. I'm coming to whip them. Just hold on until I get there, eh!
Enemy forces are converging on your position. This pitiful land is ours! You have to hold position until I come with reinforcement. Everyone is expendable in this fight!
An assault is coming on your position. We're coming with reinforcement, but you'll have to hold off on your own until then.
We did not anticipated this assault, and you are going to pay the price. I'm bringing reinforcement as fast as possible. Good luck!
They are already here. Chin up, soldier! We're on our way.
The enemy is at your door. Ring the bell and hold the wall! We're coming.
They are here. Hold!
I think they have started the attack. Hold tight, soldier.
They're already there, eh! I'll hurry. Leave some for me!
They are already on you. Don't let them take one inch!
They are already here. Keep your cool, soldier. We're coming to rescue you.
The assault has begun. Hold tight!
The cavalry has arrived! Let's show them what Atreides are capable of.
I see you haven't lost hope. Now, friends are here. It's time to push despair to their side of the field.
I'm here. Take me to them and I'll end this.
We've arrived! Well done, soldier. Now, the hunter becomes the prey!
Eh eh! I'm here. I'll make them suffer!
I'm here. We'll punish them for their arrogance, together!
We're here. Let's show them bravery. This one is for the history books.
The reinforcements have arrived. You did good. Let's finish this cleanly!
There is noise from our fremen contacts that they want [::territory_owner::-longname] gone. I think we should give them a hand. If we can prove ourselves, they'll be more favorable to us.
Eh eh! The [::territory_owner::-shortname]s have trouble with the fremen. Gives me an idea. Maybe we could use the fremen for once, and get rid of the [::territory_owner::-shortname]s.
A kerfuffle is happening in [::territory::]. We should take this opportunity to get an advantage over [::territory_owner::-longname]. If we play our cards right, the locals will take our side.
The fremen of [::territory::] are restless. They want the [::territory_owner::-shortname] gone. Let's help them with that.
The [::territory_owner::-shortname] have ruled here long enough. You've been helpful, stranger. If you are ready to finish the job, we're making an assault on their base now.
This region is mostly undefended. We're going to take it just under their nose, but we cannot bring any more forces to the fight without attracting attention.
The [::territory_owner::-shortname]s have left this place unsupervised. They might enjoy a more gentle master. I'll take it with a small force to avoid drawing attention.
My commando is on position to take [::territory::] from the [::territory_owner::-shortname]s. No reinforcements are available. I don't need them, anyway.
I've taken the initiative to lead a small force to take [::territory::]. Don't worry about it. I will hire [Mercenaries]s if needed be.
I'm gonna beat the [::territory_owner::-shortname]s to a pulp. Gotta keep a low profile, though, take them by surprise.
My special commando is more than enough to take this pitiful land from the [::territory_owner::-shortname]s.
A small force and a pouch of gold is all I need to take such a badly defended region. You can trust me.
This is a good opportunity to show [::territory_owner::-longname] how it's done. I and a few units are enough to shake things up.
Hired Help 2
You deceitful bastard! I'm going to send you back where you came from.
The snake has no choice but to deceive. The hawk has no choice but to end its life.
You're out of luck. I'm here.
You thought you could get away with an assault behind Father's back. It is my duty to stop you.
Eh eh eh! Finally a bit of excitement on this wretched planet. I gonna whip you, little worm!
What do we got here? A little worm who thinks he can take on the griffin. You'll regret this.
Only the weak use such treacherous ways. And I cannot allow weakness to prevail.
I'm used to these kind of treacheries, and I've always come up victorious. You don't impress me.
Sietch leaders throughout this region are too prideful to follow any imperial laws. Someone ought to get them in line.
Now that everyone's here, I hope they're ready for some shaking.
We must take control of this territory
Very well, and now to expand out grasp...
[Arrakeen] holds a strong, active shield, we must deactivate it from the inside. It so happens that I had a short talk with Dr. Yueh...
[!Leto] is hiding behind the shield of [Arrakeen]. Any attack would be pointless until we find a way to deactivate it from the inside.
The weak [Atreides-shortname] are cowering in their burrow. Let's take out their defenses and hit them with all we got.
Sadly, we must end [Atreides-longname]'s illegitimate occupation of Arrakis. We must first disable their shield, then [Arrakeen] will fall easily.
The shield is down. If we act fast, we will benefit from the element of surprise.
Attack! Put an end to the [Atreides-adjective] line!
It's a shame to see [Atreides-shortname] fall so low, but they're lucky we're the one to end their misery.
The [Harkonnen-shortname]s are holed up in their den. [Carthag] is a formidable fortress, but we've seen worse.
The ugly fortress in its crack is hard to break. We must take our time and be careful.
The [Harkonnen-adjective] fortress present a serious challenge, but we'll rise to the occasion.
The fortress is vulnerable. It's time to give the assault.
The so-called emperor of the whole universe is stuck in the sand. We just have to destroy his last few ships and we'll have free reign on Arrakis.
The fallen emperor is weakened. We'll show him and the whole galaxy what strength looks like. For Atreides!
Sardaukars won't be enough to save the emperor this time! This battle will be in every history books. We only have to take care of a few frail ships.
Ah! That was easy! ... Is the old fool going to try defending himself?
One bird down. Two still singing. The emperor is probably not gonna let us win so easily. ... I have a bad feeling.
That was glorious. But beware of the old emperor, he still have a few tricks up his sleeves. Something is coming.
Only one ship left. The emperor is cornered. All his pitiful might won't be enouh this time.
It's too soon for celebration. The dying lion still has claws.
Beautiful! We should expect a last-ditch effort to win from the poor emperor, but greatness is around the corner.
The [Ecaz-adjective] artists have overstayed their welcome. I like their style but they shouldn't oppose [Atreides-longname]. Let's take their glorified crib and end this non-sense.
That is [Foliage]? It's supposed to be beautiful. I ain't getting it, it's ugly! I see why we should burn it down, now.
I don't care about art. Life is not that complicated: they oppose the Emperor, they die.
To produce [Spice], you need to build a [F_Harvester_Mobile] and deploy it on a [SpiceArea] in a neutral or owned region.
Raiders can come out of hidden Sietches to free Villages from your control.
Each raid suffered gives a chance to reveal the hidden [Sietch] it came from.
[!Building_MB] slots in your Main Base are split into Districts of different sizes.
If you fill all the slots of a district with only one type of [!Building_MB], it will grant you a bonus depending on the District's size.
Assigned [Agent]s also improve the relevant [!Infiltration] level, unlocking more advanced missions.
You can trade with a [Sietch] to improve your Relations towards it.
If you reach max Relation with a [Sietch] in your territory, you can forge an alliance (using an [Agent]) to unlock its passive ability.
You can trade with a [Sietch] to improve your Relations towards it.
If you reach max Relation with a [Sietch], you can forge an alliance to unlock its passive ability. Allied [Sietch]s have an authority [!Upkeep].
The CHOAM Market allows you to buy and sell shares of the Combine Honnete Ober Advancer Mercantiles, that own all legal trade in the Imperium.
If a player ever has more than half the shares, they become majority holders and immediately win the game.
TODO
TODO
Three resolutions are put up to vote at every Council.
Each Faction can use [CouncilVote]s or [Influence] to pass or counter Resolutions.
[Supply] is refilled while staying close to a controlled [Village] or Main Base.
Villages are an important part of our growth. You have to choose what to build and where.
You should hire Militia to defend your Villages from Raiders or nearby enemies.
To produce [Spice] you must capture a Village in a region with a [SpiceArea].
Then you'll need to build a [$my(refinery)] and deploy its [$my(harvester)] to start harvesting.
Wind Traps gather [Water] in a Region depending on its wind strength.
You can increase [Spice] production by adding more [CrewPoint] to your [$my(Harvester)]s.
You can increase [Spice] production by adding more [CrewPoint] to your [$my(Harvester)]s.
The Spice to Solaris exchange rate changes frequently, think to check it.
The Spice to Solaris exchange rate changes frequently, think to check it.
When we deactivate the shield, it will not stay down for long. We have to attack immediately.
Timing is of the essence. Only put the shield down right before the attack.
The shield is back up. Retreat, regroup and start again.
We didn't get them this time. Let's start again from the start!
